~~Sorry for late. I don't quite understand why this fix works, could you explain?~~

I spent some time in investigating this issue, and believe this fix will address the issue correctly.
The root cause for this issue is we use  ```SonicV2Connector``` from ```swsscommon.swsscommon``` in ```fdbshow``` master branch. The ```keys``` method is implemented in C++ and wrapped into a python interface.
```
def keys(self, *args, **kwargs):
        return _swsscommon.SonicV2Connector_keys(self, *args, **kwargs)

```
Therefore, a exception will be raised if we pass an unicode to the interface.
```
TypeError("in method 'SonicV2Connector_keys', argument 3 of type 'char const *'",)
```
So, a conversion to str will address the issue.

@qiluo-msft @rajendra-dendukuri  do we need to add default decode_responses=True in library SonicV2Connector init() instead of the application setting it?  In future, if other application change to py3 codes, this may need to be add in the every application again.
In future this is a good idea. This PR is just a quick bug fix, so it is enough now and well tested.
@qiluo-msft

Also for the raising exception , return the exception msg which will make PING as a failure case similar to "CANNOT connect to redis server". The application won't catch exception which is not there in redis-cli. e.g , invalid namesapce case and missing/incomplete database_config.json case.

```
admin@ASW-7005:~$ sonic-db-cli -n test PING
An exception of type RuntimeError occurred. Arguments:
('test is not a valid namespace name in configuration file',)
admin@ASW-7005:~$ sonic-db-cli PING
An exception of type KeyError occurred. Arguments:
('INSTANCES',)
```

@dzhangalibaba, could you help review?

> load_sonic_global_db_config will try to read /var/run/redis/sonic-db/database_global.json, but the file in at this location is generated via database docker, how this python lib works without changing database docker first ?

The API load_sonic_global_db_config() doesn't have a strict check for the existence of database_global.json. If the file is present it parses it. I didn't want to enforce .. as this file is only present/generated in the host database docker alone, needn't be present in all namespaces. Hence it is ok -- we can go ahead with this change without changing the database docker first.

My understanding is if the global config is not there, actually it means there is no namespace introduced and the old load func will load whatever we have today. If the global config exists, it load each namespace with it own config, then based on the namespace to choose the config. 

What I noticed is with current changes in this PR, those get API accept namespace parameter, if the global config doesn't exist and the API with namespace parameter is called , it will crash , correct ? I understand for non-namespace case it is fine. 

> Yes, the program would crash with invalid namespace input. This is a indirect way of enforcing the existence of global config file -- if you need to access other namespaces and global_db json don't exist.

Also, if the global config exists, it load SonicDBConfig._sonic_db_config[''] twice ? one in load_sonic_db_config and other in load_sonic_global_db_config while doing namespace_validation ?

> Yes the idea was to keep both global_db_config and load_sonic_db_config independent.  I have updated this logic now and added an additional check in load_sonic_global_db_config, to check (if SonicDBConfig._sonic_db_config_init == True) i.e if the load_sonic_db_config is already called . If so I don't load it again.

I added sonic-db-cli PING support and add one more get_instanceslist() API in SonicDBConfig.
I tried to keep your argparse format in this PR to make your resolve conflicts easily. You may want to do a rebase. 

Sure, I did a rebase. But for some reason the code differences for sonic-db-cli shown here in the PR includes your changes as well ?

That will be a new project to add something like that. Currently,  pyswsssdk is not tested on real redis server, we only have some snmp py related unit tests based on the mock tables when building the .whl pkg in built environment. We don't have test framework which already set up redis server for testing like vs tests and sairedis tests did..  I suggest to investigate/discuss how to add py library related UT on real redis server in parallel, then we can find the best solution, this may be time consuming. To unblock the other work, I suggest go ahead with current PR and continue the sonic-db-cli replacement activities. These py lib related UT addition start in parallel.
@qiluo-msft can we merge this first , then I can sent out three other pending PRs depends on this.
